intro: Conioselinum czernaevia, commonly known as the Crimean wormwood, is a flowering plant native to the Crimea and parts of southern Ukraine. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs such as parsley and dill. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are finely divided and have a distinctive, slightly bitter aroma. Conioselinum czernaevia is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to the Mediterranean climate of its native region.
